page.title: 04The Gamekeeper
page.content: The Keeper's work follows a seasonal pattern. In the Spring he will concentrate on keeping down foxes and rabbits either by shooting, snaring or ferreting. At this time he will rear young pheasants for releasing into the wild. In Summer he prepares the shooting butts and accompanies roe deer stalking. Autumn is the time for grouse shoots when the keeper employs additional people to beat. Pheasant shooting and more roe stalking continue through to Winter when work returns to vermin control.
